page.title: 07MICHELMERSH
page.content: {HOUSING : Near the church are several {large houses, some formed from smaller {cottages. All have been {reconstructed, some extensively; some {are timber framed, others faced with {local brick. Four are thatched. Near {the village centre are bungalows of {local brick, built in 1950s, and the {former rectory, 19c. Roofs are {generally red tiles, some slates. Near {the church, three sides of a farmyard, {are several timber_framed barns {recently renovated. WORK : Much of the {polulation is retired. Others travel {to work in Romsey, Southampton, and {Winchester. A few are employed on {local farms. RECREATION : No {facilities. CLUBS : The Michelmersh {Silver Band. TRADES : The single {general store and Post Office closed {in 1981. CURRENT CONCERNS : Lack of {Main Drainage. }
